Then by all means enlighten me on what his weaknesses are. It doesn't help to SAY he has weaknesses and not actually state them.

No waveclear in sieges aside from ult (similarly, no poke). One waveclear spell that is also his main damage. Low Range for the most part. Mobility is tied to a lot of his damage - zed, leblanc, talon, kat, kassadin, kha, and Rengar can use their mobility to gapclose and still do great damage with their other abilities. Aside from his E, has pretty low base damages unless you stand there getting autoed to death with his W up. Q can be interrupted. E can be flashed. Ult's delay makes it easy to QSS, and its unlikely to hit more than 1 player if the enemy is paying attention. Core items got super expensive (Lich Bane and Zhonyas). While bursty when ahead, his W is designed for sustained damage - though it makes it harder to 1v1 him since he can chase you down, it takes him longer to reach his one-shot potential than other assassins. Pretty high cooldowns and mana costs, especially for a champ that isnt likely to rush athenes or morello. P

His strengths, though i assume you know them: slipperly. Has untargetability in kit. Execute DoT damage makes it hard to fight when low. Shark gives DFG-like effect. He can outplay you. Not the greatest stat-check champ, but does fairly well. Is a counter-assassin to other assassins after a couple items.

Because winrate and OP are different. 

Examples I can come of the top of my head with that people mention a lot on the forums are Fizz and Lux.

Lux has a high winrate and playrate due to how easy it is to play her and how favorable she is in this meta. She herself isn't broken though since she is insanely easy to kill. If she Qs and it doesn't snare you, she is dead period.

Fizz though I can see being broken since I am fairly sure not only does he have an even higher winrate than Lux. But due to his E being one of the most toxic abilities in the game. Its a Zhonyas bursting double dash on basically no CD. Anyone that plays Fizz now always gets 30-45% CDR so it will always be 4-5 seconds. The mana cost on it becomes a nonissue after a few levels or if it basically always kills. So you basically have 4 seconds to kill him before he escapes or kills you, and this is often with him coming into you more often than not. If you do start on him, he will E away or on top of you when you miss some of your abilities, so even a weak Fizz has an advantage on you always.

Because of this. Just because a champion isn't OP, that doesn't mean it isn't a problem. This is a game and its main goal should be to be always funny. If a champion's existence alone makes its opponent's life miserable, then you have to solve that problem. And the two best ways to solve it are (1) rework that champion so its more fun to play against (e.g. Poppy) (2) overnerf that champion so it's unviable enough to guarantee nobody will play it, minimizing its impact on the overall player experience (e.g. Yorick).

Fizz is utterly frustrating and innervating to play against, and sooner or later RIOT will need to acknowledge that and face that problem.

Its also an esport. "Its a game" is a pretty bad excuse for stupid balancing demands lel.
Apart from that Fizz isnt even like Yorick. Id say he is about as frustrating to play against as Le Blanc or tanks like Malphite/Voli.

And you can apply this to any recreational activity: take football or basketball. They are made to be fun as much as they are to be competitive.

So... Is Fizz constantly picked in competitive play and on top of that making games unfun? I doubt it.
